By Lattice of subextensions coincides with lattice of subgroups iff the field extension is Galois, \Bbbk / \Bbbk ^{H} is Galois, therefore we see |H|=|\mathop {\textrm {Aut}}\nolimits (\Bbbk / \Bbbk ^{H})| = [\Bbbk : \Bbbk ^{H}]. Then these two subclaims imply \Bbbk ^{\langle H_{1},H_{2}\rangle }=\mathbb {L}_{1}\cap \mathbb {L}_{2} which concludes proving (3).

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Lattice of subextensions coincides with lattice of subgroups iff the field extension is Galois

fr:mainmatter.fr:p: Let \Bbbk / \mathbb {F} be Galois and G=\mathop {\textrm {Gal}}\nolimits (\Bbbk / \mathbb {F}). Let H_{1} and H_{2} be subgroups of G corresponding to subfields \mathbb {L}_{1} and \mathbb {L}_{2}, respectively. Then the following all holds:

fr:ol.fr:li: H_{1}\subseteq H_{2} if and only if \mathbb {L}_{2}\subseteq \mathbb {L}_{1}, and in this case we have [\mathbb {L}_{1} : \mathbb {L}_{2}]=[H_{2} : H_{1}];
For every subgroup H\leq G, [\Bbbk : \Bbbk ^{H}]=|H| and also [\Bbbk ^{H} : \mathbb {F}]=[G : H];

Let \langle H_{1},H_{2}\rangle denote the subgroup of G generated by H_{1}\cup H_{2}, and let \mathbb {L}_{1}\mathbb {L}_{2} be the composite of \mathbb {L}_{1} and \mathbb {L}_{2} in \Bbbk .
